data.chText: 想象；设想
data.enText: to form a picture in your mind of what sth might be like

data.chText: 这房子正是她所想象的。
data.enText: The house was just as she had imagined it.

data.chText: 我现在无法设想没有了孩子们的生活。
data.enText: I can't imagine life without the children now.

data.chText: 闭上眼睛，设想自己在森林里。
data.enText: Close your eyes and imagine (that) you are in a forest.

data.chText: 你能想象得出干了20年之后被辞退会是什么样的滋味吗？
data.enText: Can you imagine what it must be like to lose your job after 20 years?

data.chText: 她想象着自己走进办公室，递上辞呈。
data.enText: She imagined walking into the office and handing in her resignation.

data.chText: 想想看，竟赚那么多的钱！
data.enText: Imagine earning that much money!

data.chText: 我确实能想到他那么说！
data.enText: I can just imagine him saying that!

data.chText: 我本来以为她的年龄还要大一些。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: I had imagined her to be older than that.

data.chText: “他大怒。”“我想象得出。”
data.enText: ‘He was furious.’ ‘ I can imagine .’

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.chText: 误以为；胡乱猜想；猜测
data.enText: to believe sth that is not true

data.chText: 他总是胡乱猜想我们在背后说他的闲话。
data.enText: He's always imagining (that) we're talking about him behind his back.

data.chText: 那里根本没有人，你在胡思乱想。
data.enText: There's nobody there. You're imagining things .

data.chText: 料想；认为
data.enText: to think that sth is probably true

data.chText: 我认为他们不会拒绝。
data.enText: I don't imagine (that) they'll refuse.

data.chText: “我们还能买到音乐会的票吗？”“我想可以吧。”
data.enText: ‘Can we still buy tickets for the concert?’ ‘I imagine so .’

data.chText: 以上各词均含想象、设想之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to form an idea in your mind of what sb/sth might be like.
imagine

data.chText: 指想象、设想：
data.enText: to form an idea in your mind of what sb/sth might be like

data.chText: 这房子正是她所想象的。
data.enText: The house was just as she had imagined it.
envisage

data.chText: 指想象、设想、展望：
data.enText: ( especially BrE ) to imagine what will happen in the future

data.chText: 我想象不出再与他一起工作的可能。
data.enText: I don't envisage working with him again.

data.chText: 在美国英语中，这一意义常用envision（见下）。
data.enText: The usual word for this in American English is envision (see below).
visualize

data.chText: 指在脑海中构图、想象、构思：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to form a picture of sb/sth in your mind

data.chText: 尽量设想他是一个老人。
data.enText: Try to visualize him as an old man.
picture

data.chText: 指在脑海中构图、想象：
data.enText: to form a picture of sb/sth in your mind

data.chText: 我们很难想象他居然是三个孩子的父亲了。
data.enText: We found it hard to picture him as the father of three kids.

data.chText: 用imagine、visualize还是picture？
imagine在这组词中最通用，用以想象人、地、事物或经历等，visualize和picture尤用于想象或构思图景。两词含义非常相似，只是visualize稍正式些，并常指为特定目的有意识地想象或设想。
data.enText: Imagine is the most general of these words and is used for any idea that you form of how a person, place, thing or experience might look or feel. Visualize and picture are used particularly for imagining sth in a picture. They are very similar in meaning but visualize is slightly more formal and is often used for a deliberate attempt to imagine sth for a particular purpose.
imagine, visualize or picture?
envision

data.chText: 指展望、想象：
data.enText: to imagine what a situation will be like in the future, especially a situation that you intend to work towards

data.chText: 他们向往一个没有贫穷和疾病的平等社会。
data.enText: They envision an equal society, free from poverty and disease.

data.chText: envision尤用于商业和政治语境，在北美英语中亦作envisage的变体：
data.enText: Envision is used especially in business and political contexts. In North American English it is also used as another form of the word envisage .

data.chText: 我想象不出再与他一起工作的可能。
data.enText: I don't envision working with him again.
to imagine/envisage/visualize/picture/envision sb/sth as sth
to imagine/envisage/visualize/picture/envision (sb) doing sth
to imagine/envisage/visualize/picture/envision who/what/how…
to imagine/envisage/visualize/envision that…
to be easy/hard/difficult/impossible to imagine/envisage/visualize/picture/envision

simple_means.memory_skill: imag 想象 + ine 表抽象名词 → 想象

ex.chText: 我能想象得出她的样子。
ex.enText: I can imagine what she looks like.

ex.chText: 他过去总把自己想象成一名真正的画家。
ex.enText: He always imagined himself as a real painter.

ex.chText: 想象一下没有电脑的生活。
你能想象他没有胡子的样子吗？
ex.enText: Can you imagine him without a beard?

ex.chText: 她能想象出丈夫在那些代表面前发言的样子。
ex.enText: She could imagine her husband giving a speech in front of those delegates.

synonyms.bx: 指在脑海中形成关于某人或某事物的画面。

ex.chText: 她幻想嫁一个有钱人，住到乡间去。
ex.enText: She fantasized about marrying a rich man and living in the country.

ex.chText: 有时候他幻想自己是一个电影明星。
ex.enText: Sometimes he fantasized that he was a film star.

ex.chText: 他幻想写一部伟大的小说。
ex.enText: He fantasized about writing a great novel.

synonyms.bx: 指幻想做令人愉快或兴奋的事，但这些事基本不会在现实中发生。

ex.zh: 难以/易于/很难/无法想象（或猜想）

example: I imagine she earned a lot of money with her new novel
I thought to find her in a bad state
he didn't think to find her in the kitchen
I guess she is angry at me for standing her up

tr: form a mental image of something that is not present or that is not the case
example: Can you conceive of him as the president?

value.def: If you imagine something, you think about it and your mind forms a picture or idea of it.

example.ex: He could not imagine a more peaceful scene...
example.tran: 他想象不出比这更祥和的景象。

example.ex: She couldn't imagine living in a place like that...
example.tran: 她无法想象住在那样一个地方。

example.ex: Can you imagine how she must have felt when Mary Brent turned up with me in tow?...
example.tran: 你能想象得到她看见我和玛丽·布伦特出双入对时有何感受吗？

example.ex: Imagine you're lying on a beach, listening to the steady rhythm of waves lapping the shore...
example.tran: 想象一下你正躺在海滩上,倾听海浪有节奏地轻轻拍打海岸的声音。

example.ex: I can't imagine you being unfair to anyone, Leigh.
example.tran: 利,我想象不出你会对谁不公正。

value.def: If you imagine that something is the case, you think that it is the case.

example.ex: I imagine you're referring to Jean-Paul Sartre...
example.tran: 我猜你说的是让－保罗·萨特。

example.ex: We tend to imagine that the Victorians were very prim and proper...
example.tran: 我们往往认为维多利亚时代的人们都一本正经,谨言慎行。

value.def: If you imagine something, you think that you have seen, heard, or experienced that thing, although actually you have not.

example.ex: I realised that I must have imagined the whole thing.
example.tran: 我意识到大概整件事都是我臆想出来的。

partsOfSpeech.dec: imag 想象 + ine 表抽象名词 → 想象
imagin〔e〕想象 + able 可…的 → 可想象的
imagin〔e〕想象 + ative 有…倾向（性质）的，属于…的 → 富于想象的
